steps.title: Choose which brawler you want to use.
steps.content: Choose which brawler you want to use. Currently, there are over 80 brawlers which all have a unique offensive and defensive kit. Each brawler has different attacks, so make sure you choose the right one! We'll show you how to obtain more brawlers later.

steps.title: Choose which game mode to play.
steps.content: Choose which game mode to play. There are 7 main game modes, Gem Grab, Brawl Ball, Heist, Hot Zone, Siege, Bounty, and Showdown. Sometimes there are special game modes, including Robo Rumble, Super City Rampage, Boss Fight, and Big Game. Each special game mode has levels from Normal to Insane. In Gem Grab, the objective is to get to 10 gems the fastest. Avoid dying because you will leave any gems you're carrying on the ground. Get gems from the Gem Mine, or collect them from other opponents when they are defeated. At the end of the game, the team with the most gems wins, even below 10 gems. In Bounty, kill your opponents to get stars for your team. If your team has more stars at the end, you will win. There's a blue star in each game, which counts as an extra star. In Brawl Ball, try to throw the ball into the other team's goal. You can also kill them to give your side a brief advantage. In Siege, try to collect bolts to build your team's Siege Bot, so the Siege Bot can attack the other team's IKE turret. Win by doing more damage to the other team's turret, or by destroying it completely. In Heist, your goal is to destroy the enemy safe and defend your own. In Hot Zone, your goal is to stay in a hot zone. A hot zone is an area that players can enter to gain points for their team. But be careful! When you die, the other team can enter the hot zone and gain more points than your team! The first team to get to 100 points wins! In Showdown, you want to be the last brawler alive. Break open crates to collect power cubes. Power cubes increase the damage you deal and increase your health.

steps.title: Tap the red joystick to quickfire.
steps.content: Tap the red joystick to quickfire. Quickfiring attacks the nearest adversary from you. Instead of dragging the red joystick, quick-firing is easier because it attacks the nearest brawler and all you have to do is tap.

steps.title: Drag the blue joystick to move.
steps.content: Drag the blue joystick to move. While you are moving, a white dot will be in front of you. That dot will help you know what direction you are going.

steps.title: Use ammo.
steps.content: Use ammo. Ammo is shown on the orange lines below your health bar. Once your ammo is gone, wait for it to reload. Most of the brawlers have 3 ammo slots. There are some exceptions like Max, Bea, Amber and Carl.

steps.title: Charge your Super.
steps.content: Charge your Super. A Super is an ability that every brawler has. It is a big power that can either protect you or do damage to other foes. Charge your super by dealing damage. You will know when it's charged when the yellow button on the bottom right corner turns yellow, and it makes a noise.

steps.title: Open boxes.
steps.content: Open boxes. There are 3 types of boxes. The smallest box is the Brawl Box, which has 1-3 items. Next is the Big Box, which has 1-4 items. The biggest box is the Mega Box, which has 1-7 items. In boxes, you can earn coins, which upgrades your brawlers, Power Points, which allows you to use your coins to upgrade your brawlers, gadgets, which you can use in battle, and new brawlers, which can help you advance in more trophies. If you are lucky, you might even get a Chromatic or Legendary brawler. Chromatics increase in chance of receiving every season.

steps.title: Buy things from the shop.
steps.content: Buy things from the shop. The shop is the place to go when you need more items/brawlers. You can use gems to buy brawlers, skins, and coins. Get gems from Brawl Pass rewards or purchase them from the shop with real money.

steps.title: Advance in the Trophy Road.
steps.content: Advance in the Trophy Road. Trophy Road is a place where you can get many different rewards as you gain trophies. These include credits, starr drops and coins.

steps.title: Win battles.
steps.content: Win battles. The more battles you win, the more boxes you'll be able to open. When you lose battles, the chance goes lower, and you lose some trophies. Try to win as many battles as you can!

steps.title: Invite club members or friends.
steps.content: Invite club members or friends. Club members and friends will be on your Online Players list. Click the green "Invite" button to invite them. Friend people by going to the suggested friend list and click send friend request. Join clubs by going to the club button and find a club to join!

steps.title: Ask to join other people's teams.
steps.content: Ask to join other people's teams. If somebody is already on a team, click the green "Ask to Join" button, and they might let you in. If they don't, it will say, "Team join Request was Rejected." You don't always have to invite, sometimes you can join somebody else's team!

steps.title: Let people invite YOU!
steps.content: Let people invite YOU! Some people might invite you to their team. You can click accept or reject. The maximum number of people in a team is 3 (unless it's a 5v5). Unless you are in a friendly game. Friendly games allow 10 people to join. All brawlers are fully upgraded in friendly games.
